channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Path outside nos 5 & 7 Sandfield Road

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Large pothole/man hole obstructing pathway and entrance to cul-de-sac, 4th September
item.description:
The location of the problem is directly outside Grimwade Close. It has been fenced off since mid July with no action taken to rectify the problem. It is not only causing issues for pedestrians but also for anyone who resides at Grimwade Close. It also obstructs access around the property of Number 4. No immediate action has been taken to fix the hole, apart from a fence around it. The hole is very large and the area is becoming littered.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Libertus Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes all the way up the road, 4th September
item.description:
There are a large number (10+ ) of potholes in the road which runs up to Cleeve Common from the Whittington -Syreford Road. The attached photos are merely an indication of the issues. The following What3Words gives the locations of the worst potholes. nappy.cattle.centrally clotting.camcorder.things fuses.applause.revision frantic.gazette.amazed rainwater.chess.gateway peroxide.sway.heartless lanes.tenure.rots rejoiced.cuts.revival

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New road marking are incorrect, 4th September
item.description:
A435 heading South (from bishops Cleve towards Cheltenham) the new road markings at Racecoure Roundabout incorrectly show 2 Forward only arrows and do not include a Right Turn only arrow towards Swindon Lane. Please see the attached photos from Google maps showing the old road arrows. Please arrange for these marking to be repainted corrected as they previously were at the earliest opportunity before an accident oocurs. What3Words location = ///cares.ever.stem

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Protruding metal road sign, 4th September
item.description:
Large metal road sign on corner of Bath Road and Suffolk Road has been damaged and protrudes onto the pavement, injury hazard for pedestrians especially childen at eye level. What3Words location = ///cove.minus.scale

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Suffolk Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on street during school hours, 4th September
item.description:
Parents parking in road during school pick up times is making entrance and exit to Collyberry road dangerous as you have no visibility of children crossing the road due to vehicles parking right up to the junction lines.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Collyberry Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: With school starting again this week please can you look into removing these or working out the timings on the lights so they don't cause a 35 to 40 minute wait on a Lane that should take no more than 5 minutes to drive down. Thank you, 4th September
item.description:
Hi, There are lights at the top of Paynes Pitch on Hucclecote Lane that are currently causing huge traffic issues with queues going all the way back into Hucclecote.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paynes Pitch, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Missing PROW signage at top of Blacksmith`s Lane, The Leigh, 4th September
item.description:
Missing signs on footpath at top of Blacksmith`s Lane, The Leigh. Footpath ALH26 running from near top of lane through to end of Deenes Road. Signs at both ends of this footpath have gone missing, and have been for some time. This has been reported to Highways on two previous occasions. No action taken. When are new signs going to be put up? Recently Parish Council arranged for new PROW stickers to be put up around the village, but left this footpath off; why?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown gulley, 4th September
item.description:
At the junction of Fairview Rd there is heavy growth of vegetation locking the drain as well as obstructing the drop down kerb for wheelchair users and prams. The other side if the carriageway also features heavy vegetation growth obscuring the road markings.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairview Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Unsafe paving slab, 4th September
item.description:
Outside Pret A Manger in front of one of the benches there is a paving slab that is loose and dangerous when stepped on causing a trip hazard. I recently placed a discarded traffic cone on slab to alert pedestrians of this hazard, bit alas it's since disappeared.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
